description: Ms. codex. Title from leaf 1a. Physical description: 25 lines per page; written in miniscule nastaʻliq in black on glazed, laid Arabic paper. Rubrication and catchwords. Origin: Text 1, 1 Rabīʻ I 1126 H [17 March 1714] (leaf 41b). Remaining texts likely completed around the same time. According to note on leaf 2a, texts are in the hand of the author. Holographic copy of several of the author's writings on Shiʻite fiqh.
author: Nūrī, Muḥammad Ḥusayn ibn Yaḥyá, active 18th century
contents: 3. leaves 59b-66b: Risālah fī bayān al-ḥalāl wa-al-ḥarām.
extent: 67 leaves : paper ; 183 x 122 (145 x 70) mm bound to 187 x 128 mm
title: Rasāʼil mutafarriqah
provenance: On leaf 2a, several owners' notes and stamps, and stamp of the Kitābkhānah-i Majd al-Dīn.
creator: نوري، محمد حسين بن يحيى، active 18th century
subject: Manuscripts, Arabic—New Jersey—Princeton
member of collections: Princeton Digital Library of Islamic Manuscripts
